briefdescription.para: Archives the object into the data message.

parameterdescription.para: The target data that the data will go into.
Whether or not to recursively data child views.
The data operation was successful.
NULL data message.
The archive operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new BCheckBox object from the archive message.

parameterdescription.para: The archive message to restore from.

simplesect.para: A newly created check box or NULL if the message doesn't contain an archived BCheckBox.

briefdescription.para: Draws the area of the check box that intersects updateRect.

simplesect.para: This is an hook method called by the Interface Kit, you don't have to call it yourself. If you need to forcefully redraw a check box consider calling Invalidate() instead.

parameterdescription.para: The rectangular area to be drawn.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the control is attached to a window.

detaileddescription.para: This method overrides BView::AttachedToWindow() setting the low color and view color of the BControl so that it matches the view color of the control's parent view. It also makes the attached window the default target for Invoke() as long as another target has not already been set.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the control is detached from a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been attached to a window.
Similar to AttachedToWindow() but this method is triggered after all child views have already been detached from a window.
Hook method called when the check box is moved.

parameterdescription.para: The point of the top left corner of the frame that the view has been moved to.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the check box is resized.

parameterdescription.para: The new width of the view.
The new height of the view.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the attached window is activated or deactivated.

detaileddescription.para: Redraws the focus ring around the control when the window is activated or deactivated if it is the window's current focus view.

parameterdescription.para: true if the window becomes activated, false if the window becomes deactivated.

briefdescription.para: Handle message received by the associated looper.

parameterdescription.para: The message received by the associated looper.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when a keyboard key is pressed.

detaileddescription.para: Inverts the value on B_ENTER or B_SPACE.
Overrides BView::KeyDown() to toggle the control value and then calls Invoke() for B_SPACE or B_ENTER. If this is not desired you should override this method in derived classes.
The KeyDown() method is only called if the BControl is the focus view in the active window. If the window has a default button, B_ENTER will be passed to that object instead of the focus view.

parameterdescription.para: The bytes of the key combination pressed.
The number of bytes in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is pressed.

detaileddescription.para: Begins tracking the mouse cursor.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is pressed.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when a mouse button is released.

detaileddescription.para: Inverts the check box value.

parameterdescription.para: The point on the screen where to mouse pointer is when the mouse button is released.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the mouse is moved.

detaileddescription.para: Once MouseDown() has been called on a check box this method updates the outline when the cursor is inside the control redrawing as necessary.

parameterdescription.para: The new location of the mouse in the view's coordinate system.

One of the following:
B_ENTERED_VIEW The cursor has just entered the view.
B_INSIDE_VIEW The cursor is inside the view.
B_EXITED_VIEW The cursor has left the view's bounds. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
B_OUTSIDE_VIEW The cursor is outside the view. This only gets sent if the scope of the mouse events that the view can receive has been expanded by SetEventMask() or SetMouseEventMask().
If a drag-and-drop operation is taking place this is a pointer to a BMessage that holds the drag information, otherwise the pointer is NULL.

briefdescription.para: Fill out the preferred width and height of the check box into the _width and _height parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should override this method to set the preferred size of object.

simplesect.para: Either the _width or _height parameter may be set to NULL if you only want to get the other one.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a float to store the width of the view.
Pointer to a float to store the height of the view.

briefdescription.para: Report the suites of messages this control understands.

parameterdescription.para: Allows you to add the names of the suites the check box implements to the suites array.

simplesect.para: B_OK if all went well or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a BCheckBox object from an archive message.

detaileddescription.para: This method is usually not called directly, if you want to build a check box from an archived message you should call Instantiate() instead because it can handle errors properly.

parameterdescription.para: The message to construct the BCheckBox object from.

memberdef.argsstring: (BRect frame, const char *name, const char *label, BMessage *message, uint32 resizingMode=B_FOLLOW_LEFT_TOP, uint32 flags=B_WILL_DRAW|B_NAVIGABLE)
memberdef.name: BCheckBox

briefdescription.para: Construct a check box in the frame with a name, label, model message, resizingMode, and creation flags.

detaileddescription.para:
This constructor will resize the control to its minimum height if needed for compatibility with BeOS R5.
The initial value of the check box is 0 (B_CONTROL_OFF). The label and the message parameters can be set to NULL.

parameterdescription.para: The frame to draw the check box in.
The name of the check box.
The label displayed along with the check box control.
The message to send when the check box is activated.
Defines the behavior of the check box as the parent view resizes. See BView for details.
Behavior flags for the check box. See BView for details.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a BCheckBox object with just a label and model message.

detaileddescription.para: The initial value of the check box is set to 0 (B_CONTROL_OFF). The label and the message parameters can be set to NULL.

parameterdescription.para: The label displayed along with the check box.
The message to send when the check box is activated.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *name, const char *label, BMessage *message, uint32 flags=B_WILL_DRAW|B_NAVIGABLE)
memberdef.name: BCheckBox

briefdescription.para: Construct a check box with a name, label, model message, and creation flags suitable for use with the Layout API.

detaileddescription.para: The initial value of the check box is 0 (B_CONTROL_OFF). The label and the message parameters can be set to NULL.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the check box.
The label displayed along with the check box control.
The message to send when the check box is activated. See BView for details.
Behavior flags for the check box. See BView for details.

briefdescription.para: Destructor, does nothing.
Sends a copy of the model message to the designated target.

detaileddescription.para: BControl::Invoke() overrides BInvoker::Invoke(). Derived classes should use this method in their MouseDown() and KeyDown() methods and should call IsEnabled() to check if the control is enabled before calling Invoke().

The following fields added to the BMessage:
"when" B_INT64_TYPE system_time()
"source" B_POINTER_TYPE A pointer to the BControl object.

parameterdescription.para: The message to send.

simplesect.para: B_OK if the control was invoked, otherwise an error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Return the current BAlignemnt of the view.

simplesect.para: This is only meaningful if the view is part of a BLayout.

briefdescription.para: Gives or removes focus from the control.

detaileddescription.para: BControl::MakeFocus() overrides BView::MakeFocus() to call Draw() when the focus changes. Derived classes generally don't have to re-implement MakeFocus().
IsFocusChanging() returns true when Draw() is called from this method.

parameterdescription.para: true to set focus, false to remove it.

briefdescription.para: Return the maximum size of the view.

simplesect.para: This is only meaningful if the view is part of a BLayout.
The maximum size of the view as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Return the minimum size of the view.

simplesect.para: This is only meaningful if the view is part of a BLayout.
The minimum size of the view as a BSize.

detaileddescription.para: Perform some action. (Internal Method)
This method is available to allow classes to be extended while maintaining binary compatibility.

The following perform codes are recognized:
PERFORM_CODE_MIN_SIZE:
PERFORM_CODE_MAX_SIZE:
PERFORM_CODE_PREFERRED_SIZE:
PERFORM_CODE_LAYOUT_ALIGNMENT:
PERFORM_CODE_HAS_HEIGHT_FOR_WIDTH:
PERFORM_CODE_GET_HEIGHT_FOR_WIDTH:
PERFORM_CODE_SET_LAYOUT:
PERFORM_CODE_INVALIDATE_LAYOUT:
PERFORM_CODE_DO_LAYOUT:
PERFORM_CODE_GET_TOOL_TIP_AT:
PERFORM_CODE_ALL_UNARCHIVED:
PERFORM_CODE_ALL_ARCHIVED:

parameterdescription.para: The perform code.
A pointer to store some data.

briefdescription.para: Return the preferred size of the view.

simplesect.para: This is only meaningful if the view is part of a BLayout.
The preferred size of the view as a BSize.

briefdescription.para: Resize the control to its preferred size.

memberdef.argsstring: (BMessage *message, int32 index, BMessage *specifier, int32 what, const char *property)
memberdef.name: ResolveSpecifier

detaileddescription.para: Determine the proper handler for a scripting message.

parameterdescription.para: The scripting message to determine the handler.
The index of the specifier.
The message which contains the specifier.
The 'what' field of the specifier message.
The name of the target property.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the proper BHandler for the given scripting message.

briefdescription.para: This convenience method is used to set the bitmaps for the standard states from a single bitmap.

detaileddescription.para: It also supports cropping the icon to its non-transparent area. The icon is meant as an addition to or replacement of the label.

parameterdescription.para: The icon to set.

Modify how the icon is set.
B_TRIM_ICON_BITMAP Crop the bitmap to the not fully transparent area, may change the icon size.
B_TRIM_ICON_BITMAP_KEEP_ASPECT Like B_TRIM_BITMAP, but keeps the aspect ratio.
B_CREATE_ACTIVE_ICON_BITMAP
B_CREATE_PARTIALLY_ACTIVE_ICON_BITMAP
B_CREATE_DISABLED_ICON_BITMAPS

simplesect.para: B_OK if the icon was set or an error code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Turn the check box on or off.

parameterdescription.para: The value to set the check box to, should be either B_CONTROL_ON or B_CONTROL_OFF.

briefdescription.para: Hook method called when the layout is invalidated.

parameterdescription.para: Whether or not child views have also been invalidated.

briefdescription.para: A user interface element used to make a binary decision.

detaileddescription.para: A BCheckBox is used to draw a check box UI control. This simple control has 2 states, B_CONTROL_OFF when the check box is unchecked and B_CONTROL_ON when the check box is checked. A check box can also have a descriptive label drawn to the right of the check box.

When the check box is checked it has an X drawn inside of it. The check box can be checked by a mouse click or by pushing Space on the keyboard when the check box has focus. A check box object with focus is surrounded by a blue border. A check box can also be set programmatically by calling the SetValue() method.
A few check box examples can be seen below in unchecked state, checked state, and another unchecked check box with focus on it.
